H-bridge Thyristor Inverter And Tank Circuit
=====================================================
Usage:
1.) Open http://www.falstad.com/circuit/circuitjs.html
2.) Go to "File" ==> "Import From Text"
3.) Paste entire text below "CUT HERE" into text box and click OK
4.) Enjoy & understand :) 

Explanation: When inserting an active load a thyristor bridge is capable of
acting as an inverter when connected to an external voltage source for commutation.

A parallel resonant circuit forces a sinusoidal voltage on its source. If connected
to a thyristor inverter controlled by both suitable firing angle and frequency the
tank circuit itself controls inverter commutation and is feeded by the inverter...


Issues:
1.) Since there is no feedback circuitry natural frequency is slightly below firing
frequency. Over the time firing angle decreases and there is no more energy pumped
into the tank circuit. Only then you may increase the firing angle or press "Reset".

2.) Switches to experiment with real or different bridge behavior are pointless with
this simulation, however they have not been removed. Neither were the descaling
preventors removed which leads to weird looking iA(t) when tank voltage is too high.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Credits for simulator go entirely to Paul Falstad (http://www.falstad.com/), Iain Sharp (http://lushprojects.com/),
and many more (See "About")!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------


--------------------------------CUT HERE----------------------------------
